importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news article, indicating when the death of Doug Martin was publicly announced and when the public learned of his passing.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Doug Martin's career spanned from 2012 to 2018, with his peak years at the Buccaneers, and the time frame reflects the duration of his professional football career and public recognition.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He rushed for 1,454 yards and 11 touchdowns in his rookie season, earning a Pro Bowl berth.
In 2015, he had 1,402 yards and six touchdowns and was named first-team All-Pro and Pro Bowled.
He finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns in six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin also had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers acknowledged his impact, calling him a 'lasting impact on our franchise'.
He was named one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former Tampa Bay Buccaneers All-Pro running back Doug Martin has died at the age of 36. A standout player from Boise State, Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft and earned Pro Bowl honors in both his rookie season and 2015. He compiled 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns in his professional career, with additional receiving stats. His legacy includes being named one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration. The team and his family expressed deep sorrow over his sudden and unexpected passing, with the cause of death currently unconfirmed.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
